Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 05:25PM nikkiannej wrote: Hi Shabby, I had the excisional biopsy on my right breast on 02-14-08.  After the surgery the surgeon spoke to me and my husband and said she did not have good news and that she didn't want to lie to us that she wasn't sure if my lump was cancerous or not.  I think my surgeon knew by looking at the lump and the tissue if it is benign or malig.  On 02-22-08 I went for my post op visit and she told me that I have a 1.8 cm tumor, Stage I cancer.  I had the sentinel lymph node biopsy on 03-20-08 and luckily the cancer did not spread to my lymph node.  Good Luck Shabby
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy on Monday. Results?? shabby6485 nikkiannej

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 05:06PM nikkiannej wrote: Hi Ladies, The Oncotype DX office called me on 4-07-08 to approve the testing and the results were faxed to my breast specialist/surgeon on 04-11-08. It took 5 days.  I was at the breast specialist's office yesterday, Friday and she told me my recurrence score was 13.  I have an appointment to see an oncologist next Friday.  My doctors said I might not need chemo but will be on medication.  My tumor size was 1.8 cm and had Stage I cancer.  On 2-14-08 I had the excisional biopsy. On 03-20-08 underwent the sentinel lymph node biopsy. Good Luck Ladies
Posts.Title: Oncotype DX results?? matic22 rockwell_girl

Posts.Content: Apr 19, 2008 05:50PM nikkiannej wrote: Hi Rockwell Girl, Thanks. That's excellent that you do not have any side effects.  Do you know how long you have to take tamoxifin.  I heard that some people have to take medication daily for five years.  I'm scared about what type of treatment that I will need.  I'm just afraid of the bad side effects that it may or may not give me.  Wow, you ran five miles today.  You go girl!  I get tired very easily.  I just walked around my neighborhood one time last week and had to stop because I was tired.   Take care, you will be running for life for a very very long time.
